TopicTitle: Quick question about placing maneuver nodes

Articles.Content:
Hi there, new here.

I get a little .... about having perfectly circular orbits, and it drives me a little batty that I cant select the precise point of apoapsis or periapsis on my orbit path to place a node. 

OR CAN I AND I DONT KNOW ABOUT IT?

I have looked around, and cant find any information on this. Is there a way to select the AP or PE points precisely instead of eyeballing it?

Thanks!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-07T19:19:37Z" title="05/07/2015 07:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 7, 2015</time> by KingWolfWorm**

The AP and PE markers on your orbit indicate Apoapsis and periapsis.

Is that not what you are referring to?

There's not really a way to select the precise location of your AP or PE for a maneuver node, but you can get pretty close by comparing the time to maneuver and time to AP/PE. You'll know you got it almost spot on when your AP and PE switch location almost instantly with the addition of tenths of m/s dV, that should give you a AP and PE that are only a couple hundred meters apart.

Sorry dude, I just do not know. Thankfuly, there are subforums for those people who want new features or mods.

EDIT: Bad post because I was on mobile.
